The Act titled "Perkins County Rural Water System Act of 1999" recognizes the Perkins County Rural Water System as part of the Southwest Pipeline Project, authorized by the North Dakota State Legislature and Congress. The Perkins County Rural Water System Act of 1999 defines key terms such as Corporation, Feasibility study, Project construction budget, and Pumping and incidental operational requirements related to the water supply system. The Perkins County Rural Water System Act of 1999 defines key terms such as Corporation, Feasibility study, Project construction budget, and Pumping and incidental operational requirements related to the water supply system. The term "water supply system" includes intake facilities, pumping stations, water treatment facilities, cooling facilities, reservoirs, and pipelines operated by the Perkins County Rural Water System, Inc., to the point of delivery of water to each entity that distributes water at retail to individual users. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior, acting through the Commissioner of the Bureau of Reclamation. The Secretary will provide grants to the Corporation for the planning, construction, and repairs of the water supply system to ensure conservation of resources. Construction funds will only be available after meeting environmental requirements and submitting a final engineering report and water conservation plan to Congress. Mitigation of fish and wildlife losses due to the water supply system construction will be based on ecological equivalency. Portions of the system can use power from the Pick-Sloan Missouri Basin Program from May 1 to October 31. The federal share of assistance will be provided. SEC. 7. FEDERAL SHARE: Federal share is 75% of project construction budget for water supply system under section 4, including cost increases after March 1, 1995. SEC. 8. NON-FEDERAL SHARE: Non-Federal share is 25% of project construction budget for water supply system under section 4, including cost increases after March 1, 1995. SEC. 9. CONSTRUCTION OVERSIGHT. SEC. 9. CONSTRUCTION OVERSIGHT.

The Secretary may assist the Corporation in overseeing construction of the water supply system. Funds used for planning and construction may not exceed 3% of the total project budget for the portion in Perkins County, South Dakota.

SEC. 10. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.

$15,000,000 is authorized for planning and construction of the water supply system. Additional funds may be appropriated for cost increases after March 1, 1995.
